channel.title: Comments on: Book Review: Get Strong at Joseki 2

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Definitely! Let me know if you ever join a tournament and maybe I can join you one day!
item.content:encoded: Definitely! Let me know if you ever join a tournament and maybe I can join you one day!

item.title: By: pollylop
item.dc:creator: pollylop
item.description: Thanks, good to hear it. To be honest, even though am a fairly new follower of the blog, was feeling a little guilty about never having said thanks for all the cool stuff I've enjoyed here. Glad those demons were put to rest. :) Never actually played an OTB game but am really looking forward to it (seems like it would be fun to be able to play tournaments someday too).
item.content:encoded:
Thanks, good to hear it. To be honest, even though am a fairly new follower of the blog, was feeling a little guilty about never having said thanks for all the cool stuff I’ve enjoyed here. Glad those demons were put to rest. ðŸ™‚
Never actually played an OTB game but am really looking forward to it (seems like it would be fun to be able to play tournaments someday too).

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Thank you so much for taking the time to write something so thoughtful! You have no idea how much it means to know that my time and effort on this blog is appreciated. I will be sure to keep working hard to make this blog even better! If you ever have any requests, be sure to let me know! And I hope we can meet across the board some day!
item.content:encoded: Thank you so much for taking the time to write something so thoughtful! You have no idea how much it means to know that my time and effort on this blog is appreciated. I will be sure to keep working hard to make this blog even better! If you ever have any requests, be sure to let me know! And I hope we can meet across the board some day!

item.title: By: pollylop
item.dc:creator: pollylop
item.description: Sounds interesting (for the primary reason you listed) as do these: http://senseis.xmp.net/?WholeBoardThinkingInJoseki Probably not appropriate for my level, but something to look forward too. :) Gonna take the opportunity to say thank you - for all the love and fun you put into this blog! It's one of the best mind sport pages I've run across. Have found a good deal of useful information and even a little inspiration here. For example, am just about to finish up with GGPFB vol 2 and read somewhere on here (in the comments I think) were you suggest starting with 1001 Life & Death Problems at least before moving on to GGPFB vol 3. Have noticed 1001 sitting on my shelf and thought, "that book is gonna learn me something about this game once I finally get to it" - the day will come a little sooner then anticipated. :) Your enthusiasm for the game is infectious (in a good way). Thanks again and, best wishes in your journey with Go!
item.content:encoded:
Sounds interesting (for the primary reason you listed) as do these: http://senseis.xmp.net/?WholeBoardThinkingInJoseki Probably not appropriate for my level, but something to look forward too. ðŸ™‚
Gonna take the opportunity to say thank you – for all the love and fun you put into this blog! It’s one of the best mind sport pages I’ve run across. Have found a good deal of useful information and even a little inspiration here.
For example, am just about to finish up with GGPFB vol 2 and read somewhere on here (in the comments I think) were you suggest starting with 1001 Life & Death Problems at least before moving on to GGPFB vol 3. Have noticed 1001 sitting on my shelf and thought, “that book is gonna learn me something about this game once I finally get to it” – the day will come a little sooner then anticipated. ðŸ™‚ Your enthusiasm for the game is infectious (in a good way).
Thanks again and, best wishes in your journey with Go!
